article:
:''For other uses, see Affection (disambiguation).



'Affection' or 'fondness' is a "disposition or rare state of mind or
body" [http://dictionary.reference.com/search?q=affection affection -
Definitions from Dictionary.com ] that is often
associated with a feeling or type of love. It has given rise to a number of
branches of philosophy and psychology concerning emotion, disease, influence,
state of being, [http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/emotions-
17th18th/LD7Hutcheson.html 17th and 18th Century Theories of Emotions > Francis
Hutcheson on the Emotions (Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy) ] "Affection" is popularly used to denote a feeling or
type of love, amounting to more than goodwill or friendship. Writers on ethics
generally use the word to refer to distinct states of feeling, both lasting and
spasmodic. Some contrast it with [[passion (emotion)|passion]] as being free
from the distinctively sensual element.
